div.pre: 2058 Strongoli (anc. Petelia), 25 km. N of (1012) Croton, Bruttium, 1880 Burial: 1st cent. B.C.? (K) Contents: 1 EL, 6 AR, 4 AE. From a plundered tomb Social War: 1 den. (as BMC, p. 330, 31) Petelia: 3 AE (Apollo/Artemis; Demeter/ Zeus; Mars/Victory) Suessa: 1 AE (Pallas/cock) Syracuse: 1 EL (Apollo/lyre) Roman Rep.: 5 den. (families Calpurnia, Cassia, Cipia, Minucia, Servilia) Disposition: dispersed NSc 1881, p. 97 The association of these coins is doubtfully ancient. The Syracusan electrum is late 4th cent.; the AE coins are 3rd cent.; and the identifiable Roman AR are Cipia, late 2nd cent. and Social War den. early 1st cent. The gold coin of Justinian reported as associated with the above must in any case be intrusive
